Reviews.Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2024
Reviews.Review Text: The arrival of my Kindle was heralded by the sounds of triumphant horns, and as I gathered the artistically crafted box containing my e-reader to my bosom I knew something special was about to occur. Opening the box brought forth a light like unto a warm summer's day, yea verily, like unto the soft kiss of a summer's promised love. The e-reader sat upon a cloud made of the happy wag of a puppies' tails and unicorn kisses, held firmly but softly, like a hard-boiled egg in a cup made of fine china, not clinging like a castaway in a storm but a gentle hand, as to that of a mother and her child. Dare I say a moment of purest joy emanated from my heart, the love poets often try to describe in their verse, or a painter captures in the strokes of their brush, yet still often eludes. Had I the words to express the glory of Amazon, I would put it so forth onto paper, electronic or the compressed wood pulp of yore. But I am simple man, who loves the bibliographical, and can only hope to delve into but a splinter of the sum of all written literature before being shuffled off this mortal coil by hands of those beings only dimly imagined.
